name: Sukuma Wiki
description: Sukuma Wiki, meaning 'to push the week,' is a nutritious and economical Kenyan dish made with collard greens, often cooked with onions and spices, and is a perfect complement to Ugali.
steps: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add onions and sauté until translucent.
Add minced garlic and continue to sauté for about 1 minute.
Add the chopped collard greens, stirring to combine with the onions and garlic.
Season with salt, pepper, and a pinch of cayenne for heat.
Cover and simmer over low heat until the greens are tender, adding a little water if necessary.
Serve hot with Ugali or as a side dish to any meal.
tips: Wash the collard greens thoroughly to remove any grit or dirt.
Cut the greens into thin strips for faster cooking.
Adding a squeeze of lemon juice before serving can enhance the flavor.
